intro: Diphaca trachycarpa, commonly known as the rough-seeded diphaca, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are deeply lobed and covered in a rough, hairy texture, giving it its common name. Diphaca trachycarpa is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
